text: It will cover scope, grammar rules, static analysis including checks for common gate errors and undeclared qubits, a GitHub Actions-based CI integration setup, error taxonomy, and a development roadmap with phases and estimated timelines.
It will read QASM 2.0 source files ( including any included libraries ) and perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program .
perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program
The tool should report clear error messages and warnings for invalid QASM constructs.

## Grammar Rules  
The analyzer must implement the full OpenQASM 2.0 grammar as specified by IBM’s QASM reference ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
Only one version statement is allowed and it must appear first .
it must appear first .

Comments begin with ` // ` and run to end - of - line ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) ) .
run to end - of - line ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text

- * * Include Statements :* * Lines of the form ` include " filename " ; ` must be parsed so that the specified file is opened and its contents processed in place ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) ) .
its contents processed in place ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text

Support declarations ` qreg name[size ] ; ` and ` creg name[size ] ; ` for quantum and classical registers ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this ) ) .

` creg name[size ] ; ` for quantum and classical registers ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this ) )

Identifier names start with a lowercase letter and may contain alphanumeric characters or underscores ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this ) ) .

may contain alphanumeric characters or underscores ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this )
For `qreg name[N]`, the elements `name[j]` for `0 ≤ j < N` denote individual qubits initialized to |0〉; similarly `creg name[N]` defines bits `name[j]` initialized to 0

- `CX q1,q2;` applies a CNOT gate with control `q1` and target `q2` ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20built,quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa)).
Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=called%20the%20controlled,index%20j%20into%20register%20a)).

- `measure q -> c;` measures qubit(s) `q` (single qubit or register) into classical bit(s) `c` ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)).
`q` must be qubit(s) and `c` must be bit(s); the arrow `->` syntax is required.

Support user-defined gate (subroutine) syntax as per the QASM 2.0 spec ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body)):
  - **Named Gates:** `gate name(params) qargs { body }`.

The body is a block of existing gate calls (built-in or previously defined gates) and barrier statements ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body))

- * * Opaque Gates :* * ` opaque name(params ) qargs ; ` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified ( no body ) ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = computationally%20challenging%20to%20estimate , declaration%20but%20without%20a%20body ) ) .
` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified ( no body )

Subroutines ( gates ) must be declared before use and can not be recursive ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = Only%20built , The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by ) ) .

The parser should faithfully implement the QASM 2.0 grammar for all of the above constructs, reporting syntax errors (e.g. missing semicolons, mismatched parentheses, invalid tokens) as parsing failures.

In particular , it should enforce that the version statement occurs only once at the top and that all statements end with semicolons as required ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) )

that all statements end with semicolons as required ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text

For multi - qubit gates ( like ` CX q1,q2 ` ) , check that the same qubit is not used twice ( for example , ` CX q[0],q[0 ] ` is invalid ) ; the QASM spec explicitly forbids the same qubit in both roles ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = called%20the%20controlled , register%20and%20b%20is%20a ) ) .
= called%20the%20controlled , register%20and%20b%20is%20a ) )
In general, if a parallel operation is applied to quantum registers, they must have matching sizes.

For example , a unitary ` U ` or custom gate must take quantum arguments ( qubit or qreg ) , not classical bits , and ` measure ` must map qubits to bits ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built , c ) ) .

` measure ` must map qubits to bits ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built , c ) )
The `if` statement syntax `if(creg==int) qop;` must use a classical register on the left of `==` and an integer literal on the right.
Applying a gate to a classical register, or a measurement target that is not a classical bit, should be flagged.

For built - in gates , ` CX ` must have exactly two quantum arguments ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20built , quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa ) ) , and ` U ` must have three real - parameter arguments .

Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20built , quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa ) ) , and ` U ` must have three real - parameter arguments .

In gate definitions, ensure bodies follow spec rules ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=Only%20built,The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by)).
For example , parameter names and qubit arguments should be properly scoped , and only allowed statements ( gates , barrier ) appear .
only allowed statements ( gates , barrier ) appear
These are not syntax errors but potential logic bugs, and should be reported as warnings.
Collectively , these checks will catch common QASM mistakes such as undeclared qubits , duplicate registers , wrong gate arity , type errors , and unreachable or ill - formed code .
ill - formed

For example , if a gate name is undefined , the analyzer should produce a compile - time error ( “ gate X undefined ” ) ( [ Support ` extern ` gate declarations   · Issue # 507 · openqasm / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / openqasm / openqasm / issues/507#:~:text = In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before , them%20available%20to%20the%20user ) ) rather than silently proceeding .
silently proceeding
The project will use **GitHub Actions** for continuous integration (CI) to ensure code quality and reliability.
pull request

On each push or pull request , the pipeline checks out the code , sets up a Python environment ( e.g. via ` actions / setup - python ` ) , installs dependencies , and runs the test suite using ` pytest ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) ) .

sets up a Python environment ( e.g. via ` actions / setup - python ` ) , installs dependencies , and runs the test suite using ` pytest ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) )

installs dependencies , and runs the test suite using ` pytest ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt )

runs the test suite using ` pytest ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt )
testing Python - GitHub
Tests should cover parsing of valid QASM examples, detection of error conditions, and the static analysis checks.
running ` ruff ` ( or ` flake8`/`pylint `

For example , a step installing and running ` ruff ` ( or ` flake8`/`pylint ` ) ensures adherence to style and catches common Python issues ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For , format%20code ) ) .

catches common Python issues ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For , format%20code ) )
testing Python - GitHub
Any linting errors should fail the build.
then automatically package the tool ( e.g. build a Python wheel )
Semantic versioning is adopted , and the CI may automate bumping the version and creating a GitHub Release .
the CI may automate bumping the version and creating a GitHub Release .
creating a GitHub Release
The CI logs should clearly show version tags and changelogs.

Each of these CI steps references standard examples from GitHub documentation ([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt))

([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For,format%20code)).

For instance , the pytest step might run commands like ` pip install pytest pytest - cov ` followed by ` pytest --cov = src --cov - report = xml ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) ) , and the lint step might run ` pip install ruff ` then ` ruff check .
testing Python - GitHub
the lint step might run ` pip install ruff ` then ` ruff check .

([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For,format%20code)).
The CI configuration should be documented in the repository (e.g. `.github/workflows/ci.yml`).

Undefined-gate errors are semantic; as one report notes, “the frontend will record an error saying that the gate `cx` is undefined” when it cannot find a gate symbol ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user)).

Examples include gates or registers that are defined but never used ( dead code ) , or operations on a qubit after it has been measured without reset ( since the qubit ’s state is no longer well - defined ) ( [ Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ : A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software - lab.org / publications / fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text = analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same ) ) .
never used ( dead code ) ,

This structured error taxonomy (syntax vs semantic vs logical) helps users understand the nature of an issue: syntax and semantic errors must be fixed, while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non-critical problems.

## Roadmap

Support all grammar rules outlined above, including version, registers, includes, built-in statements, and gate definitions ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
At this stage, most semantic errors (undeclared names, type mismatches, duplicate definitions) should be detected.

Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = called%20the%20controlled , register%20and%20b%20is%20a ) ) , validate ` if ` statements , and implement logical warnings ( unused definitions , post - measure use ) ( [ Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ : A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software - lab.org / publications / fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text = analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same ) ) .
validate ` if ` statements , and implement logical warnings ( unused definitions , post - measure use )
implement logical warnings ( unused definitions , post - measure use )

Configure GitHub Actions workflows for testing and linting ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) )
linting (
testing Python - GitHub

([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For,format%20code)).
By the end , the team will have a fully tested QASM 2.0 parsing and analysis toolkit , with continuous integration ensuring quality and facilitating future maintenance .
facilitating future maintenance

The above requirements draw on the OpenQASM 2.0 specification ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))

Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)), and examples of static analysis in quantum programs ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user))

( [ Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ : A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software - lab.org / publications / fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text = analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same ) ) , as well as standard Python CI practices ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) )
